title: Director, Training and Development
description:
**Company Overview**



Immunome is a clinical\-stage targeted oncology company committed to developing first\-in\-class and best\-in\-class targeted cancer therapies. We are advancing an innovative portfolio of therapeutics, drawing on leadership that previously played key roles in the design, development, and commercialization of cutting\-edge therapies, including antibody\-drug conjugate therapies. Our pipeline includes varegacestat, a late\-clinical stage GSI; IM\-1021, a clinical\-stage ROR1 ADC; and IM\-3050, a FAP\-targeted radiotherapy that recently received IND clearance. We are also advancing a broad portfolio of early stage ADCs pursuing undisclosed solid tumor targets.

**Position Overview**



Immunome is building the commercial capabilities required to prepare for launch and scale a high\-performing field organization. The Director, Training \& Development will own the strategy, roadmap, and operating model for commercial training across Sales, Marketing, and other customer\-facing roles. This leader will design and deliver launch curricula, scalable onboarding, coaching and manager toolkits, and a continuous learning engine—while ensuring training governance, compliance, and medical accuracy in close partnership with Medical Affairs and Compliance. This person will also design and deliver medical field training curricula.



In addition, this role will lead commercial development programming that supports people development across all Commercial functions. The Director will partner closely with HR to build and support all\-organization development initiatives, positioning Commercial to lead the way in designing and delivering high\-quality, impactful, and relevant development experiences.


**Responsibilities**


**Commercial Training Leadership**


* Develop and own Immunome's commercial training strategy, roadmap, and operating model for field teams (Sales, Marketing, and customer\-facing roles).
* Build scalable onboarding and continuous learning programs aligned to brand strategy, field competencies, and organizational priorities.
* Design, develop, and deliver launch curricula for Field Sales and field customer\-facing medical roles (as applicable), including selling skills, market landscape, competitive insights, objection handling, and customer engagement excellence.
* Create an all\-commercial competency model (role\-based expectations, proficiency levels, and assessment approach) to support readiness, development, and performance coaching.
* Establish and maintain a Sales Manager coaching framework, including manager toolkits, observation guides, field coaching routines, and reinforcement mechanisms.


**Learning Infrastructure, LMS \& Scalable Enablement**


* Implement and evolve training infrastructure, including learning platforms/LMS, SOPs, templates, and scalable content management processes.
* Build role\-based learning pathways and certification journeys that support launch readiness and ongoing development.
* Leverage modern enablement approaches (microlearning, blended learning, reinforcement, and knowledge checks) to improve retention and field application.


**Launch Meetings, Workshops \& Field Readiness Events**


* Lead the strategy, planning, and execution of launch meetings, National Sales Meetings (NSM), and cross\-functional field training events.
* Oversee agenda design, applied learning experiences, content development, vendor coordination, and onsite execution.
* Design and deliver launch meeting workshops that translate brand strategy into field\-ready execution, including message pull\-through and scenario practice.


**Training Measurement, Evaluation \& Continuous Improvement**


* Establish an evaluation strategy with dashboards, KPIs, and feedback loops to measure training effectiveness and readiness impact (completion, certification, proficiency, and field adoption).
* Partner with Sales Leadership and commercial stakeholders to assess performance gaps and deploy targeted learning solutions.
* Drive continuous improvement by incorporating field insights, performance data, and stakeholder feedback into training updates and reinforcement.


**AI\-Enabled Training Innovation**


* Champion responsible use of AI\-enabled tools to accelerate content creation, streamline updates, and increase scalability while maintaining quality, compliance, and medical accuracy.
* Establish governance and best practices for compliant AI use across training content and delivery.
* Evaluate emerging learning technologies and integrate tools that improve speed\-to\-readiness and knowledge retention.


**Commercial Development**


* Oversee the design, implementation, and management of commercial development programs and projects to support all functions within Commercial.
* Build and maintain development pathways that support skill growth and career progression across Commercial roles, using a variety of development approaches (e.g., workshops, cohorts, coaching, self\-paced learning, experiential assignments, and peer learning).
* Partner with Commercial leaders to assess development needs and prioritize initiatives that strengthen capabilities, leadership, and organizational effectiveness.
* Partner with HR to build and support all\-organization development initiatives, ensuring Commercial leads the way in developing and delivering high\-quality, impactful, and relevant development experiences.


**Medical Training (Disease State \& Product Only)**


* In partnership with Medical Affairs, develop training modules focused on disease state, epidemiology, mechanism of action, clinical data, safety, and patient journey.
* Ensure medical training content is aligned with approved scientific resources and remains within non\-promotional boundaries.
* Design and support implementation of medical field on\-boarding encompassing all aspects of required medical on\-boarding needs.


**Cross\-Functional Leadership, Governance \& Compliance**


* Partner closely with Commercial, Medical Affairs, HR, Legal/Regulatory, and Compliance to ensure training content and national meeting materials meet applicable standards.
* Oversee training governance and compliance processes (e.g., content review workflows, certification standards, documentation practices) in alignment with internal requirements.
* Build and manage relationships with external agencies, instructional designers, and meeting vendors; manage budgets, scopes of work, and performance expectations.


**Qualifications**


* Bachelor's degree required; advanced degree preferred.
* A minimum of 10 years of experience in biotech/pharmaceutical commercial training, medical training, and/or commercial operations.
* Proven experience building or scaling training functions and leading national meetings in a high\-growth or launch\-ready organization.


**Knowledge and Skills**


* Experience designing and delivering development programs and pathways that support skill building and career growth; ability to partner effectively with HR and cross\-functional stakeholders.
* Demonstrated ability to translate complex clinical and strategic content into clear, engaging, role\-based learning experiences.
* Experience partnering with Medical Affairs and Compliance to deliver medically accurate, compliant training content.
* Strong project management, communication, and stakeholder alignment skills; comfort operating in a fast\-paced, highly collaborative environment.
* Vendor and budget management experience.
* Strategic and execution\-oriented leader with a builder mindset and comfort operating with ambiguity.
* Scientific fluency and the ability to simplify complex concepts for field application.
* Strong facilitation skills; credible presence with senior commercial leaders and field audiences.
* Deep understanding of commercial onboarding, selling skills, coaching, and competency frameworks.
* Demonstrated capability to design and scale people development programs and create role\-based development pathways.
* Fluency in learning measurement approaches (KPIs, dashboards, readiness metrics) and continuous improvement methodologies.
* Ability to identify and deploy AI\-enabled solutions to increase training speed, scalability, and quality while maintaining governance and compliance.
* High integrity with a demonstrated commitment to compliant behaviors and patient\-centricity.

**E/E/O**



Immunome, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.


**E\-Verify**



Immunome, Inc. is a participant in E\-Verify. Please review the following notices: E\-Verify Participation Poster \| Right to Work Poster (English) \| Right to Work Poster (Spanish).

title: Manager - Enablement Delivery & Events
description:
**Company Description**  

Organizations everywhere struggle under the crushing costs and complexities of “solutions” that promise to simplify their lives. To create a better experience for their customers and employees. To help them grow. Software is a choice that can make or break a business. Create better or worse experiences. Propel or throttle growth. Business software has become a blocker instead of ways to get work done.

  

**There’s another option. Freshworks. With a fresh vision for how the world works.**

  

At Freshworks, we build uncomplicated service software that delivers exceptional customer and employee experiences. Our enterprise\-grade solutions are powerful, yet easy to use, and quick to deliver results. Our people\-first approach to AI eliminates friction, making employees more effective and organizations more productive. Over 72,000 companies, including Bridgestone, New Balance, Nucor, S\&P Global, and Sony Music, trust Freshworks’ customer experience (CX) and employee experience (EX) software to fuel customer loyalty and service efficiency. And, over 4,500 Freshworks employees make this possible, all around the world.

  

***Fresh vision. Real impact. Come build it with us.***

 **Job Description**  

We are looking for an energetic, creative, and highly organized professional to serve as our Manager \- Enablement Delivery \& Events. This role is dedicated to orchestrating high\-impact internal events for the global GTM organization and delivering effective enablement programs that empower our Americas Field teams. The ideal candidate will have a strong track record in sales enablement and delivery, with the ability to think strategically while executing the logistics of global GTM events.

**\*Please note this role will require 25%\-30% travel.\***

**This is a hybrid role that will be based in Bellevue, WA and requires an in\-office presence three days per week (Tuesday \- Thursday).**


GTM Events \& Communications

* Lead the strategic planning, content management, and onsite execution of annual GTM Kickoffs. Manage logistics, agendas, and speaker prep in partnership with internal stakeholders and external vendors.
* Plan and execute immersive quarterly in\-person training events for new hires.
* Support stakeholders with planning and execution of mid\-year and team events and training activities.
* Draft and deliver regular communications including newsletters, announcements, leadership updates and team\-wide briefings.
* Monitor the effectiveness of communications and events using surveys, feedback, open rates and participation metrics.


Enablement Delivery \& Training

* Develop and deliver engaging and informative sales training programs, both in\-person and virtually, that align with the overall sales strategy and goals.
* Regularly communicate with the field to gather feedback, assess needs, and ensure the sales enablement program meets the evolving requirements of the sales team.
* Collaborate with marketing, product, and enablement partner teams to create high\-quality sales collateral, presentations, and playbooks that effectively communicate product value propositions and sales messaging.
* Work closely with sales leadership to identify training needs and develop customized training plans for sales teams.
* Provide ongoing support and resources to sales managers, ensuring they are equipped to reinforce best practices, drive team performance, and address individual development needs.
* Assess the effectiveness of training programs and make recommendations for improvement.

 **Qualifications*** Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, or a related field; additional certifications in training and development are a plus.
* 7\+ years of combined experience in enablement and sales, preferably in a technology company
* Extremely strong delivery skills, both in\-person and virtually
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills
* A proactive and adaptable mindset with a commitment to continuous improvement.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a talent for storytelling and tone
* Proven ability to manage events across international, cross\-functional teams
* Highly organized, proactive and comfortable working in a fast\-paced, high\-growth environment
* Strong collaboration skills, with experience partnering with senior leaders
* Familiar with tools such as Slack, Zoom, Google Workspace, and event planning platforms

 **Additional Information** **This is a hybrid role that will be based in Bellevue, WA and requires an in\-office presence three days per week (Tuesday \- Thursday).**


The expected base salary range for this position is as shown below. The actual base pay is dependent upon a variety of job\-related factors such as professional background, training, work experience, business needs and market demand. Therefore, in some circumstances, the actual salary could fall outside of this expected range. This pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role is also eligible for a target bonus.


Compensation Package


$154,000\-$202,125 USD Base Salary \+ Bonus

  

Freshworks offers multiple options for dental, medical, vision, disability and life insurances. Equity \+ ESPP, flexible PTO, flexible spending, commuter benefits and wellness benefits are also offered. Freshworks also offers adoption and parental leave benefits.


At Freshworks, we have fostered an environment that enables everyone to find their true potential, purpose, and passion, welcoming colleagues of all backgrounds, genders, sexual orientations, religions, and ethnicities. We are committed to providing equal opportunity and believe that diversity in the workplace creates a more vibrant, richer environment that boosts the goals of our employees, communities, and business. **Fresh vision. Real impact. Come build it with us.**

title: HR Manager
description:
**Be a People \& Systems Leader at a Mission‑Driven Healthcare Organization**



Are you an HR professional ready to step into a management role where your leadership, systems thinking, and interpersonal strengths can shine? Wallace is seeking an HR Manager to manage the daily HR operations and serve as the primary resource for staff and leaders. This role is ideal for an experienced HR professional who’s ready to take full ownership of HR processes, strengthen systems, and support a mission‑driven team.

  


**Key Details:**


* **Compensation:** $80,000\-$90,000 per year, DOE
* **Schedule:** Full time, Monday\-Friday, with four days onsite and one remote day after onboarding
* **Location:** 18633 SE Stark St., Portland, OR 97233
* **Benefits:** Medical, Dental \& Vision Insurance (Wallace covers employee premiums 100%); PTO (three weeks in the first year, four weeks starting in year two); Employer paid Short and Long‑Term Disability; Life \& AD\&D; FSA/DCFSA; 401(k) with match; Employee Assistance Program.

  


**About Us:** At Wallace, we're on a mission to improve the health outcomes of our community. As a not for profit Federally Qualified Health Center, we've been a stable and trusted healthcare provider for over 40 years. Founded by Dr. James Reuler, Wallace began by bringing essential medical care to uninsured and low\-income residents. Today, we offer comprehensive medical, dental, and behavioral health services, staying deeply connected to our vibrant, multicultural community. We stay deeply connected to our multicultural community and believe in supporting the whole person, including our staff.

  


**Why You’ll Love This Role:**


* **Hands‑On HR Leadership:** Step confidently into HR management with full responsibility for day to day HR work.
* **Systems Ownership:** Build and maintain strong HR processes, documentation, and workflows.
* **People Centered Environment:** Work in a mission‑driven culture that values communication, clarity, and collaboration.
* **Variety \& Impact:** Influence key aspects of employee experience, culture, and organizational success.
* **No Weekends!** Stable Monday\-Friday schedule.

  


**What You’ll Do:**


**HR Leadership \& Compliance**


* Serve as the primary HR point of contact for employees and managers.
* Manage day to day HR operations, documentation, and compliance with an emphasis on building and maintaining efficient systems.
* Interpret and apply employment laws, policies, and HR best practices, offering clear guidance grounded in both organizational needs and legal requirements.
* Partner with leadership and external HR support on complex or sensitive matters.


**Employee Relations \& Culture**


* Build trusting, transparent relationships with staff across the organization, maintaining a steady, calm presence in challenging conversations.
* Provide direct support, coaching, and clarity to leaders and employees, addressing needs while upholding policies and boundaries.
* Lead employee relations work including performance conversations, conflict resolution, and navigating interpersonal dynamics in a community health environment.
* Help cultivate a positive, inclusive, and supportive workplace culture with a proactive interpersonal approach.


**Core HR Operations**


* Manage benefits administration and open enrollment, acting as the primary contact with brokers and internal stakeholders.
* Oversee leave administration, ADA accommodations, and offboarding with clarity, consistency, and care.
* Maintain personnel files, records, and HR communication workflows with strong attention to structure, organization, and system efficiency.
* Coordinate with payroll and admin support on timecards, credentialing, and compliance requirements.
* Lead recruitment and hiring processes, including sourcing mission aligned candidates and coordinating a smooth interview experience.
* Deliver an effective onboarding experience and oversee performance management cycles, including reviews and Personnel Change Notices.

  


**What We’re Looking For:**


* Bachelor’s degree in business, HR, or related field or equivalent experience preferred.
* 3 \- 5 years of progressive HR experience, demonstrating increased responsibility and readiness to step into management.
* Strong systems, organization, and process‑development skills.
* Excellent interpersonal, communication, and relationship‑building abilities.
* Capacity to work independently and bring clarity, structure, and follow‑through.
* Solid understanding of HR compliance and employment laws.
* Experience in healthcare or ADP is helpful but not required.
* PHR or SHRM‑CP is a plus.

  


*Wallace is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe in the power of community health. We value diversity, inclusion, and the strength that comes from serving a vibrant community. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.*

title: Human Resources Coordinator
company: Park Chenaur and Associates, Inc., P.S.
description:
Position Summary

The HR \& Office Operations Coordinator supports day\-to\-day people operations and office operations. This role manages PTO administration, benefits support, office support tasks, and basic accounting coordination (AP/AR). You’ll be the person who keeps the internal engine running—organized, accurate, responsive, and consistent.

Key Responsibilities

**PTO \& Leave Administration**

* Track and administer PTO requests and balances accurately.
* Maintain PTO and leave records in our HR/payroll systems.
* Communicate PTO policies clearly and ensure consistent application.
* Coordinate leave documentation and ensure proper tracking (as applicable).

**Benefits Support**

* Assist with employee enrollments, changes, and terminations for benefits.
* Serve as the first point of contact for basic benefits questions and issue triage.
* Coordinate with benefits brokers and providers to resolve employee issues.
* Maintain benefits documentation and ensure employee communications are organized and timely.

**Office Support / Operations**

* Handle office supply ordering, vendor coordination, and general office logistics.
* Support onboarding/offboarding logistics (workspace setup, access requests, basic forms).
* Help keep internal processes clean (templates, checklists, shared drive hygiene, etc.).
* Provide general admin support to leadership and staff as assigned.

**AP/AR Support**

* Assist with accounts payable: coding, processing invoices, and coordinating approvals.
* Assist with accounts receivable: tracking outstanding invoices and basic follow\-up.
* Maintain organized records and support bookkeeping/accounting processes.
* Coordinate with outside bookkeeper/accountant as needed.

Qualifications (Must\-Have)

* 2\+ years in HR admin, office operations, or similar coordination role.
* Experience managing PTO tracking and benefits administration support.
* Comfortable with AP/AR basics (invoices, approvals, tracking payments).
* Strong attention to detail and follow\-through—no dropped balls.
* Strong communication skills: clear, direct, professional.

Preferred Qualifications

* Experience in a professional services environment (law firm, medical office, etc.).
* Familiarity with HRIS/payroll systems (ADP, Paychex, Gusto, etc.).
* Experience working with vendors, brokers, and external accounting support.
* Strong Excel/Google Sheets ability.

Core Skills / Traits

* Organized, consistent, and process\-driven
* Discreet with confidential information
* Calm under pressure; handles interruptions well

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: $40,000\.00 \- $55,000\.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off

Work Location: In person

title: Senior Human Resources Generalist
description:
**Position Overview:**

The Senior HR Generalist is a people\-focused operator who helps ensure we consistently have the Right People in the Right Seats by executing our people processes with clarity and consistency. This role is the primary owner of day\-to\-day HR administration, compliance execution, employee lifecycle processes, and people data integrity. The Senior HR Generalist ensures our recruiting, onboarding, training, documentation, and offboarding processes are documented, followed\-by\-all, and compliant. Partnering closely with the President and outsourced HR resources, this role supports role clarity, accountability, and a positive employee experience while maintaining accurate, audit\-ready people systems.

**Key Responsibilities include but are not limited**

* Own the day\-to\-day execution of HR processes across the employee lifecycle, ensuring they are documented, followed\-by\-all, and compliant
* Serve as the primary owner of HR administration, employee records, HRIS data integrity, and people documentation.
* Maintain HR workflows, checklists, and systems to support consistent, audit\-ready processes.
* Execute full\-cycle recruiting and hiring logistics, ensuring alignment with Core Values and

GWC.

* Execute onboarding and offboarding using documented processes, including I\-9s, background checks, HRIS setup, system access changes, and Day 1 readiness.
* Support role clarity through accurate job descriptions and documentation aligned with the Accountability Chart (under leadership direction and approval).
* Track and manage employee training, certifications, safety documentation, and required renewals.
* Maintain HR policies and employee documentation and support compliance with Washington employment laws (updates under leadership direction and approval).
* Administer benefits enrollment, life events, renewals, drug testing, and related HR programs in coordination with vendors, the union, and outsourced HR.
* Track employee status changes, attendance, leave, and PTO accuracy.
* Serve as the first point of contact for employee HR\-related questions and support managers with documentation and employee concerns, escalating as appropriate.
* Support EOS People tools, HR metrics, and Scorecard data for leadership and Level 10 meetings.
* Support annual wage equity review preparation, employee recognition milestones, and culture, engagement, and internal communication initiatives.

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**

* Strong understanding of end\-to\-end people operations and HR process flow.
* Ability to independently manage multiple HR functional areas with minimal oversight.
* Demonstrated judgment, discretion, and professionalism in handling sensitive matters.
* Strong attention to detail, documentation, and follow\-through.
* Effective communicator with employees, managers, and external partners.
* Ability to prioritize competing demands in a fast\-paced, operational environment.
* Experience supporting leaders without serving in a strategic policy\-setting role.
* 3–6 years of progressive HR generalist or HR operations experience.
* Experience with HRIS platforms, onboarding, recordkeeping, and benefits administration
* Prior experience working in an EOS environment is a plus
* Familiarity with WA employment laws preferred (training provided).

Job Type: Part\-time

Pay: $37\.00 \- $45\.00 per hour

Expected hours: 24 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Work Location: In person

title: Principal, Employee Listening & Sensing
description:
**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**
------------------------


This role sits within NIKE’s global People Analytics \& Insights (PAI) team known for its analytical rigor, storytelling excellence, and deep partnership across HR and the global enterprise. The Principal, Employee Listening \& Sensing serves as a thought leader and subject matter expert in the Employee Listening function, partners closely across PAI, and collaborates with key partners within HR (e.g., HRBP, Talent COE) and stakeholders outside of HR (e.g., Legal/Privacy, Communications, business units).

**WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR**
--------------------------


We are looking for a strategic thinker who blends research expertise, analytical depth, and storytelling craft. This ideal individual thrives in complexity, translating data into insight and insight into action. They excel at mixed‑methods analysis, stakeholder partnership, and navigating ambiguity with confidence. This ideal candidate elevates employee voice, influences senior leaders, and pushes the Employee Listening discipline forward with bold thinking and inclusive leadership. They bring curiosity, precision, and a commitment to delivering insights that drive real impact for teammates across the globe.

**You will have:**

* 8\+ years in consulting, research, analytics; 5\+ years of experience in employee listening, survey research, people analytics, organizational research within large, complex organizations.
* Master’s degree in Industrial/Organizational Psychology, Behavioral Science, Analytics, or related field. PhD is preferred. Will accept any suitable combination of education, experience and training.
* Demonstrated expertise in end‑to‑end delivery of large‑scale survey programs, including advanced statistical analysis and mixed‑methods integration.
* Exceptional ability to synthesize quantitative and qualitative data into actionable insights and compelling narratives.
* Strong project management, stakeholder engagement, and communication skills.
* Recognized ability to influence senior leaders and drive data‑informed decision‑making.

**WHAT YOU’LL WORK ON**
-----------------------


You’ll lead NIKE’s global employee engagement survey program from strategy through delivery, shaping how employee voice informs decisions across the enterprise. You’ll turn data into insights meaningful storytelling, strengthening the employee voice at scale.

**In this role, you will:**

* Lead the strategy, design, methodology, sampling, item writing, reporting and dashboards for NIKE’s enterprise‑wide survey programs.
* Oversee execution of the global engagement survey, ensuring rigor, quality, and meaningful insights.
* Integrate quantitative and qualitative data to create holistic, actionable stories that matter to the business.
* Partner across People Analytics \& Insights (PAI), HR Centers of Excellence (COEs), Communications, Legal/Privacy, and business units to activate insights and close the feedback loop.
* Translate complex findings into compelling narratives for senior HR and executive audiences.
* Champion employee voice across the enterprise and influence leaders to take insight‑driven action.
* Identify opportunities to evolve methodologies, strengthen capabilities, and scale innovation in Employee Listening, ensuring deliveries of insights that are tightly linked with business and HR priorities


We offer a number of accommodations to complete our interview process including screen readers, sign language interpreters, accessible and single location for in\-person interviews, closed captioning, and other reasonable modifications as needed. If you discover, as you navigate our application process, that you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please complete the Candidate Accommodation Request Form.

title: Human Resources - Talent Acquisition Specialist
description:
Why Join Our Recruiting Team?
  
We are growing and looking for someone who is passionate about taking care of people and putting employees first!
  
Our team partners closely with leaders to attract top talent, support employees through key moments, and help shape a strong, positive workplace. We are seeking someone who thrives in a fast\-paced environment, handles confidential information with discretion, and takes pride in building great teams.
  
If you are dependable, people\-focused, and excited to make a meaningful impact through recruiting and HR, we encourage you to apply today!
  
Summary
  
The Talent Acquisition Specialist is responsible for managing full cycle recruiting efforts across the organization. This role works closely with hiring managers to post openings, source and screen candidates, coordinate interviews, and support the hiring process from initial outreach through onboarding, ensuring a smooth and professional candidate experience.
  
Experience recruiting in construction, telecom, or field\-based environments is strongly preferred.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
* Support full cycle recruitment including sourcing, screening, interviewing, selection, and offer coordination
* Partner with hiring managers and HR Partners to understand current and future workforce needs
* Source candidates using job boards, trade schools, universities, career fairs, industry associations, and social media
* Identify and build new candidate sources to support growth and hard to fill roles
* Participate in weekly staffing meetings to provide updates on open positions, candidate activity, and hiring progress
* Assist with planning and attending recruiting events to support outreach and candidate engagement
* Ensure recruiting activities remain compliant with applicable employment laws and company policies
* Maintain confidentiality of candidate and employee information at all times


Minimum Qualifications
  
* Highly detail oriented with strong organizational and prioritization skills
* Ability to manage multiple open requisitions in a fast paced environment
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Collaborative team player with the ability to build trust with leaders and candidates
* Working knowledge of recruitment compliance and onboarding requirements
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
* Experience in Dayforce a plus!


Other Requirements
  
* Must pass pre\-employment background and drug screening
* Occasional travel up to 20 percent may be required
* Valid driver’s license required


Position Type and Expected Hours of Work
  
This is a full\-time position with a typical work schedule of Monday – Friday, 8:00 am – 5:00 pm with overtime requirements or as directed by leadership.
  
  

Benefits
  
The Company offers a comprehensive benefits package that is designed to enhance all aspects of our employees’ well\-being. In addition to competitive pay, our benefits package includes:
  
* Health, dental, and vision plans (for team members and their families)
* Financial planning through our 401(k) program
* Additional benefits including life and disability insurance
* The Company encourages a healthy lifestyle by providing paid time off to our valued team members.


EEO Statement
  
Ontivity provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability and genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Ontivity complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Ontivity expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information disability or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Ontivity’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

title: Human Resources Specialist
description:
Overview:

Provides clerical and administrative support to the Human Resources Department on all personnel and HR matters. Provides prompt customer services and communications to internal and external individuals. Requirements for this job change frequently with changing priorities.


Responsibilities:
* Perform customer service functions by responding to employee requests and questions via phone, email, or in person.
* Responsible for the new hire onboarding for assigned companies to include scheduling pre\-employment tests, review background check results, enter new hire information into various systems, create and maintain employee file, reporting employees to the state, and acting as main administrator of E\-Verify.
* Process terminations to include termination letters, system maintenance and applicable benefit forms and appropriate, timely communications.
* Verify mariner credentials, enter licenses, certifications, tests and trainings into internal systems.
* Verify and maintain I\-9 documentation for active and terminated employees.
* Process lifecycle activities in ADP such as position changes, transfers, and pay changes.
* Maintains other records, reports, and logs to conform to EEO regulations.
* Managing employee physical and drug testing results and reconciling medical testing invoices.
* Creating and running reports using ADP.
* Create letters using mail merge.
* Process educational reimbursements.
* Create sea time letters and random drug testing letters for maritime employees.
* Ensure accurate and timely maintenance of files and records.
* Accurate, courteous, timely response to customers, vendors, employees regarding inquiries.
* Contribution to daily administrative activities of organization.
* Assist with general office maintenance and clean up as necessary.
* Assist Human Resources Director as requested.
* Performs other related duties as required.


Qualifications:
* High School diploma or GED.
* A minimum of two years’ experience in an office environment, HR preferred.
* Experience using ADP, Cornerstone OnDemand, SharePoint, and iCIMS preferred.
* Computer skills that include, but not limited to: Microsoft Word, Excel \& Outlook and typing of a minimum of 60 words per minute.
* Must be able to multi\-task and prioritize in a fast paced, high volume setting.
* Extremely detail oriented with a high degree of accuracy.
* Exceptional verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills are a must along with a positive, can\-do attitude.
* Maintain the confidentiality of all sensitive communications.
* Ability to work with all levels of employees using courtesy, tact, and good judgment.
* Ability to understand and execute complex oral and written instructions.
* Must be able to read, speak, write, type, and understand English in person and over phone.
* Valid Washington State driver's license.


Job Condition and Environment:
* Work with computers, fax machines, copiers, mail/postage machines, telephones.
* Required to sit for long periods of time.
* Infrequent light physical effort required.
* Must have reliable transportation and be able to run errands.


Expected Hours of Work:
* Normal office hours are 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Monday through Thursday. Friday can be flexible in\-office or remote, however it may be required to be in office on Fridays, as needed.
* It is expected that you may work beyond normal office hours as required, based on department demands, goals and projects.


Company Overview:

Centerline Logistics is a leading provider of marine transportation services in the United States. Centerline Logistics operates on the United States West Coast (including Alaska and Hawaii), United States East Coast (including Puerto Rico), the United States Gulf Coast and the Mississippi River System. Services provided include the transportation and storage of petroleum products, tanker escort, ship assist, the transportation of general cargo and rescue towing. Centerline Logistics is the parent company of eight businesses specializing in marine services and a bulk liquids terminal business. Centerline Logistics provides accounting, administrative, human resources, safety and environmental services, and other support to the subsidiary companies.  

The Company offers Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and AD\&D options to our employees and their eligible dependents after meeting Company requirements. 401(k) options, Disability Insurance, sick pay, vacation pay, 10 paid holidays per calendar year (subject to work schedule) and Healthcare and/or Dependent Care FSAs are also available to our employees after meeting Company requirements. All benefits information may be subject to change based on any current or updated benefit plan year changes and/or Collective Bargaining Agreements.  

We are an Equal Employment Opportunity and Drug Free Work place. Pre\-employment drug testing is required.

title: Plant HR Generalist
description:
Title: Plant HR Generalist  


Location: Boardman, OR  


Job Requisition ID: Req\-260086  


Time Type: Full time  

About Lamb Weston
You’ve probably enjoyed our fries without even knowing it! As a leading manufacturer in our industry, and public Fortune 500 company, we inspire and bring people together with foods they love and trust. Our customer base includes international food service providers, restaurants, and households in over 100 countries around the world.
A highly innovative global corporation with a start\-up mindset, we empower every individual to make a genuine difference. You’ll gain access to hands\-on training to fuel your growth and success, explore opportunities for new solutions, and you’ll join a winning team of 10,000\+ people all dedicated to raising the bar – together.
If you have a strong drive for results, a desire to help us bring the world together through our fries, and are ready for a fresh challenge, we want to hear from you.
Job Description Summary  


The Plant HR Generalist acts as an HR liaison and is responsible for partnering with management, various departments, and team members to ensure human resources deliverables are met.  

  

Duties may include overseeing retention, hiring, orientation, employee relations, project management, training \& development, and coordination of HR planning initiatives.
Job Description* Provides day\-to\-day business HR partnership and consultation for assigned functional team.
* Participates in the implementation and maintenance of HR policies, practices, and procedures by providing professional and technical assistance to leadership and key stakeholders.
* Assists in driving business solutions through ad hoc reporting and analysis of HR statistics/data which may include turnover, job requisitions, new hires, transfers, promotions, terminations, team member performance, and more.
* Leads and supports Human Resource programs including but not limited to employment/unemployment, litigation, retention, termination, turnover, and severance.
* Partners and collaborates on projects/programs with cross\-functional HR peers, centers of excellence (COE), and business support functions including Talent Management, Compensation, Payroll, Benefits, Finance, and Legal.
* Ensures and supports HR compliance with local and statutory laws and regulations.
* Collaborates with Talent Acquisition and key stakeholders on hiring goals, future talent pipelining, organizational development, and the administrative processing of job requisitions to meet business hiring needs.
* Provides support and training for team members, supervisors and managers which may include managing team member performance, employee relations, workplace training, and new hire training.
* Updates and manages team member information/bulletin boards including company policy documents, announcements/events, benefits details, and/or legally required notices.
* Serves as the HR representative on assigned projects, committees, and community events.
* Leads HR initiatives, champions change, and grows team member engagement to create a culture aligned with our values: Teamwork, Empowerment, Integrity, Inclusion, and a Drive for Results.

Basic \& Preferred Qualifications* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or related field required.
* Advanced degree or certification specific to human resources preferred.
* Minimum 3 years of professional experience in Human Resources required.
* Knowledge and experience ensuring and supporting HR compliance with local and statutory laws and regulations required.
* Prior experience working with and/or optimizing timekeeping, payroll, Human Capital Management (HCM), or Human Resources compliance systems and processes preferred.
* Experience with benefits/compensation administration, market pricing, labor law, and organizational development preferred.
* Computer proficiency with software systems including but not limited to Human Resources Management Systems (HRMS), Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook etc.) and/or other web\-based applications required.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written; Strong interpersonal skills required.
* Experience in a manufacturing environment is preferred.
* Impeccable attention to detail and organizational skills required.

Industry\-Competitive Benefits
Coupled with our compensation and bonus incentive programs, our benefits deliver rewards that are market competitive. Some of the most attractive elements of our benefit programs include:* Health Insurance Benefits \- Medical, Dental, Vision
* Flexible Spending Accounts for Health and Dependent Care, and Health Reimbursement Accounts
* Well\-being programs including companywide events and a wellness incentive program
* Paid Time Off
* Financial Wellness – Industry leading 401(k) plan with generous company contributions, Financial Planning Services, Employee Stock purchase program, and Health Savings Accounts, Life and Accident insurance
* Family\-Friendly Employee events
* Employee Assistance Program services – mental health and other concierge type services


Benefits may vary based on location, job role/level, job status, and/or the terms of any applicable collective bargaining agreements.  

Anticipated Close Date
The anticipated close date is a good faith estimate for when this job will be closed. Some jobs may be unposted or filled earlier or later than the Anticipated Close Date depending on interview processes and business needs.  


Anticipated Close Date: 04/19/2026  

Pay Transparency
In compliance with applicable state and local laws, Lamb Weston has opted to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation for this role. This compensation is specific to this position and takes into account a number of variables. Actual compensation may be higher or lower in the range posted based on various factors, including, but not limited to, job duties, experience and expertise. A candidate's work location could also impact the actual compensation being outside of the range to reflect local cost of labor. A reasonable annual estimate of the range for this role is listed below.  


Pay Rate or Range: $63,160\.00 \- $94,750\.00  

Equal Opportunity Employer
Lamb Weston is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status or any other protected factor under federal, state or local law

title: Human Resources Coordinator
description:
**Delta Hotels by Marriott Seattle Everett**  

3105 Pine Street  

Everett, WA 98201  


  

**HUMAN RESOURCES COORDINATOR**  

Delta Hotels by Marriott Seattle Everett is seeking an organized and experienced HR Coordinator to support human resources operations at our beautiful 232\-room, full\-service hotel.
  

This position plays a key role in maintaining structure, consistency, and professionalism across all HR processes. The HR Coordinator works closely with the General Manager and Corporate HR to support recruitment, onboarding, employee relations, compliance, and day\-to\-day HR administration across multiple departments including Rooms, Food \& Beverage, Banquets, Sales, and Engineering.
**THE ROLE**
The HR Coordinator supports core HR functions at the property level, ensuring processes are handled accurately and consistently. This includes recruitment coordination, onboarding, benefits administration, record\-keeping, and compliance tracking.
  

The role also assists the General Manager and department leaders with coaching and corrective action processes, helping ensure documentation is clear, consistent, and aligned with company standards. The HR Coordinator partners with Corporate HR on more complex employee relations matters as needed.
  

This position serves as a trusted resource for managers and employees regarding policies, benefits, and procedures while maintaining appropriate professional boundaries in a fast\-paced hotel environment.
**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**
* Coordinate recruitment and onboarding for all hotel departments
* Maintain accurate, confidential personnel files and HRIS records
* Administer benefits enrollment and respond to employee benefit inquiries
* Support hotel safety program and workers’ compensation return\-to\-work process.
* Respond to unemployment requests and attend unemployment hearings.
* Track compliance requirements, training records, and required postings
* Support managers with performance documentation and corrective action processes
* Ensure completion of required company and brand training and ongoing employee engagement.
* Review written documentation for clarity and policy alignment
* Assist with employee relations matters and escalate when appropriate
* Ensure consistent application of company policies and employment practices
**WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR**
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
* Experience supporting coaching and performance management processes
* Ability to review documentation for clarity and consistency
* Professional discretion when handling confidential matters
* Clear communicator who works well with both managers and employees
* Comfortable operating in a high\-volume, multi\-department hotel environment

**QUALIFICATIONS**
* 2–4 years of HR experience, preferably in hospitality or multi\-department operations
* Associate degree in HR, Business Administration, or related field
* Working knowledge of employment law and HR best practices
* Experience with HRIS systems and Microsoft Office; ADP Workforce Now preferred
* Ability to work a minimum of 32 hours per week, ideally across five days

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**
This work requires the ability to sit for long periods of time and computer use, with occasional walking, bending, reaching, or carrying light items for filing, training, or safety inspections. Hand and finger dexterity is necessary for typing, writing, and other routine office tasks. Visual acuity is required to read documents, forms, and computer screens accurately. Auditory ability must allow effective communication in person, by telephone, and in group settings, even with background noise.

**SCHEDULE:**
* On\-site, Monday \- Friday
* 32\-40 hours per week

**RATE OF PAY:**
* $23\.54 to $26\.06 per hour/DOE

**BENEFITS AND PERKS:**
* Paid Time Off
* Holiday Pay
* Paycheck Advancement Program
* Hotel Travel Discounts
* Supplemental Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee Meals

For eligible employees:
* Insurance \- Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and AD\&D
* 401(k) Plan with Employer Match


  

**Drug Free Workplace, Equal Opportunity, E\-Verify Employer**

title: Human Resource Manager
description:
**Advance your HR career** while partnering with leading healthcare professionals in a dynamic, collaborative environment.


We are looking for an experienced HR leader to join our team as the Human Resource Manager.

### **Position Summary**


The Human Resource Manager is responsible for overseeing all HR functions within the Skilled Nursing Facility, ensuring compliance with federal, state, and local regulations while supporting a positive, high\-performance workplace culture. This role partners closely with facility leadership to oversee hiring and onboarding, manage employee relations, staffing support, regulatory compliance, and workforce development in a fast\-paced healthcare setting.

**Exciting Benefits Await You:**

* Attractive Compensation: Enjoy competitive pay that truly values your contributions.
* Generous PTO and 401(k) plan.
* Comprehensive Benefits Package: Benefit from a wide range of options, including dental, health, vision, and disability insurance.
* Wellness Program Access: Prioritize your health with resources designed to support your well\-being.
* Inclusive Workplace Culture: Thrive in a supportive environment that champions diversity and collaboration.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelors degree preferred.
* Emphasis in human resources management preferred.
* One year of prior human resources or employee training and development experience preferred.

**Salary/ Wage Range**

**$32\.00 \- $37\.00 / hour**


Compensation for this role is determined by several factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, and experience, and may vary outside of the listed salary range.

**DEI Statement**


We are dedicated to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, we ensure fair and unbiased practices in recruiting, hiring, and promotion, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability, or protected veteran status. We proudly support individuals with military experience—including active\-duty members, veterans, reservists, and National Guard—as well as military spouses and encourage them to apply for our career opportunities.

title: Orchard HR/H2A Manager
description:
**COMPANY OVERVIEW** 

Legendary Fruit Company is a vertically integrated tree fruit (apples, pears, and cherries) grower, packer and distributor based in Chelan, Manson and Wapato, Washington. Through a series of acquisitions, we have assembled one of the largest tree fruit platforms in the country with proprietary varieties, regional diversification, and a large quantity of fruit.

We passionately share the awesomeness of apples, pears and cherries with everyone, everywhere. Our vision is to be the most trusted partner in the fruit industry, known for our legendary people, farms, growers and products.

**Job Duties and Responsibilities:**

· Partner with managers and supervisors to implement and uphold HR policies, procedures, and best practices.

· Communicate policy updates and coordinate required training and educational initiatives.

· Manage H\-2A contracts and support temporary worker housing in coordination with Orchard operations.

· Supervise Orchard HR team members.

· Administer the workers’ compensation program, including new claims and ongoing case management.

· Oversee employee training programs for orchard and warehouse operations.

· Manage employee benefits administration, including enrollments, changes, and employee support.

· Lead recruitment, sourcing, and onboarding efforts in collaboration with leadership.

· Administer the full employee lifecycle, from onboarding through offboarding.

· Process unemployment claims and employment verification requests.

· Complete annual regulatory compliance filings.

· Collaborate with the Director of Human Resources and Warehouse General Manager on policies, procedures, and employee\-related matters.

· Perform additional duties as assigned.

**Education \& Experience:** 

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or a related field required. Equivalent related experience may be considered in lieu of formal education.
* Minimum of five (5\) years of progressive Human Resources experience required.
* Bilingual proficiency in Spanish required.
* Valid driver’s license required.
* Valid transportation required.
* Experience with Paylocity HRIS system preferred.
* Experience with GANAZ onboarding system preferred.

**Physical Requirements/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:**

· Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

· Must be able to access and navigate each department at the organization’s facilities.

· Ability to write, communicate, understand, remember, and apply oral and/or written instructions or other information in English and Spanish.

· Ability to plan, organize, and carry out assignments from management staff with minimal direction.

· Ability to analyze situations, interpret data and make decisions that have moderate impact on immediate work unit.

· Ability to organize and prioritize job duties in an effective and timely manner, set priorities and meet critical deadlines.

· Ability to maintain accurate files and records.

· Physical requirements for this position include hearing, seeing, speaking, feeling, reaching, pinching, and repetitive motions.

· This position requires standing and walking for long periods of time.

· This position requires exerting up to 20 pounds of force in order to lift, carry, pull, or move objects.

Full Benefit Package Includes:

Medical, Dental, Vision, Long Term Disability, Life Insurance, 401k, 401k match, paid holidays, paid vacation and paid sick leave.

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: $100,000\.00 \- $110,000\.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Chelan, WA 98816 (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Chelan, WA 98816: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Human Resources - Specialist
description:
Why Join Our HR Team?
  
We are growing and looking for someone who is passionate about taking care of people and putting employees first.
  
Our HR team is collaborative, proactive, and deeply committed to doing things the right way. We partner closely with leaders, support employees through important moments in their careers, and play a key role in shaping the culture of our organization. This is an opportunity to contribute to a team that supports our people and helps strengthen our culture every day.
  
We are seeking someone who thrives in a fast\-paced environment, handles confidential information with professionalism and discretion, recruits top talent, and is ready to contribute in a meaningful way every day.
  
If you are dependable, people\-focused, and excited to grow with a team that leads with integrity and shows up for one another, we encourage you to apply today!
  
Summary
  
The HR Specialist will partner closely with the HR team to support recruiting efforts, benefits administration, compliance, and day to day HR operations. This position requires strong judgment, discretion, and the ability to manage sensitive matters with professionalism and care.
  
  

Key Responsibilities
  
* Serve as a primary point of contact for employees regarding benefits, policies, time off, and general HR inquiries
* Maintain and audit personnel records and HRIS data to ensure accuracy, confidentiality, and compliance
* Support full cycle recruiting and onboarding across multiple offices and divisions
* Support company compliance program efforts across all locations
* Partner with leadership and HR team members on employee appreciation initiatives and employee care programs
* Provide guidance and support on escalated employee matters, including policy interpretation, corrective action, and ensuring consistent application of company standards
* Assist with workers compensation administration, leave management, and return to work coordination
* Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and company policies


Qualifications
  
* Minimum of 2 years of progressive HR experience, including employee relations and workers compensation administration
* Working knowledge of federal and multi state labor laws including FMLA, ADA, EEO, OSHA, and related regulations
* Demonstrated ability to manage sensitive situations with discretion, empathy, and consistency
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize competing demands
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Experience working in a multi location environment preferred


Other Requirements
  
* Must pass pre employment background and drug screening
* Occasional travel up to 20 percent may be required
* Valid driver’s license required


Position Type and Expected Hours of Work
  
This is a full\-time position with a typical work schedule of Monday – Friday, 8:00 am – 5:00 pm with overtime requirements or as directed by leadership.
  
  

Benefits
  
The Company offers a comprehensive benefits package that is designed to enhance all aspects of our employees’ well\-being. In addition to competitive pay, our benefits package includes:
  
* Health, dental, and vision plans (for team members and their families)
* Financial planning through our 401(k) program
* Additional benefits including life and disability insurance
* The Company encourages a healthy lifestyle by providing paid time off to our valued team members.


EEO Statement
  
Ontivity provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability and genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Ontivity complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Ontivity expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information disability or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Ontivity’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

title: Director, Compensation Strategies - Advisory
description:
Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today's most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It's also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it's no wonder we're consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Seramount, Fair360 and others. If you're as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.
  
KPMG is currently seeking a Director, Compensation to join our Talent \& Culture organization.Responsibilities: Drive the compensation strategy for KPMG's Advisory business, acting as the primary compensation team liaison to Advisory's leadership team; serve as a compensation subject matter professional for Advisory and responsible for the development, implementation and communication of total rewards strategies and programs that support the business objectives of the functionServe as an internal liaison and consultant with respective client group on all compensation matters (day to day administration, special projects, and year\-end compensation cycle); collaborate and partner with internal clients – including Advisory Human Resources and Finance leadership as well as analyze complex problems or issues and provide compensation strategic or tactical solutionsPrepare and deliver presentations to function leadership that identifies issues and includes total compensation tactical and strategic recommendations and/or solutions; interpret market survey results to establish funding requirements for various pay programsLead compensation efforts through relevant workstreams, steering committees, ad hoc projects, and more throughout the yearResearch new approaches to Tax compensation and bring future forward new ideas and concepts for considerationAct with integrity, professionalism, and personal responsibility to uphold KPMG's respectful and courteous work environmentQualifications: Minimum twelve years of recent, broad\-based compensation experience in a business or financial services consulting environment or other high growth industryBachelor's degree from an accredited college or universityStrong PC skills required including Excel, Access or other database experience, PeopleSoft exposure is a plusSolid analytical, organizational, project management and influencing skillsAbility to think strategically and to link action plans to critical business prioritiesExcellent ability to multi\-task on several key projects; strong oral and written communication skillsApplicants must be authorized to work in the U.S. without the need for employment\-based visa sponsorship now or in the future; KPMG LLP will not sponsor applicants for U.S. work visa status for this opportunity (no sponsorship is available for H\-1B, L\-1, TN, O\-1, E\-3, H\-1B1, F\-1, J\-1, OPT, CPT or any other employment\-based visa)
  
KPMG LLP and its affiliates and subsidiaries (“KPMG”) complies with all local/state regulations regarding displaying salary ranges. If required, the ranges displayed below or via the URL below are specifically for those potential hires who will work in the location(s) listed. Any offered salary is determined based on relevant factors such as applicant's skills, job responsibilities, prior relevant experience, certain degrees and certifications and market considerations. In addition, KPMG is proud to offer a comprehensive, competitive benefits package, with options designed to help you make the best decisions for yourself, your family, and your lifestyle. Available benefits are based on eligibility. Our Total Rewards package includes a variety of medical and dental plans, vision coverage, disability and life insurance, 401(k) plans, and a robust suite of personal well\-being benefits to support your mental health. Depending on job classification, standard work hours, and years of service, KPMG provides Personal Time Off per fiscal year. Additionally, each year KPMG publishes a calendar of holidays to be observed during the year and provides eligible employees two breaks each year where employees will not be required to use Personal Time Off; one is at year end and the other is around the July 4th holiday. Additional details about our benefits can be found towards the bottom of our KPMG US Careers site at Benefits \& How We Work.Follow this link to obtain salary ranges by city outside of CA:
  
\#\#\#https://kpmg.com/us/en/how\-we\-work/pay\-transparency.html/?id\=1215\_9\_25\#\#\#
  
**California Salary Range:** $155000 \- $311000
  
KPMG offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding KPMG's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please.KPMG recruits on a rolling basis. Candidates are considered as they apply, until the opportunity is filled. Candidates are encouraged to apply expeditiously to any role(s) for which they are qualified that is also of interest to them.Los Angeles County applicants: Material job duties for this position are listed above. Criminal history may have a direct, adverse, and negative relationship with some of the material job duties of this position. These include the duties and responsibilities listed above, as well as the abilities to adhere to company policies, exercise sound judgment, effectively manage stress and work safely and respectfully with others, exhibit trustworthiness, and safeguard business operations and company reputation. Pursuant to the California Fair Chance Act, Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
